item.description:
Join us as we check out a popular local event. After Hours at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum is a monthly event featuring live music, art, conversation, cocktails and more in an inviting atmosphere. Linger around the courtyard bar and listen to live music or sample the tasty menu in the Gardner Café. Experience something different each month – from impromptu gallery talks to cutting-edge contemporary performance – and spend time in the galleries exploring what the Gardner is all about.

Courtyard Music: Violinist Emil Altschuler and guitarist Jerome Mouffe perform from 5:30-7pm and then again from 8:15-9pm.
Artist Talk @ 7pm: Stop by the special exhibition gallery for a talk about the exhibition by artist Taro Shinoda
Viewfinder Conversations: Join a discussion about John S. Sargent’s famous portrait of Isabella Gardner (every half-hour), plus other impromptu gallery discussions (6 to 8:30PM)

We will meet by the ticket purchasing area. If you have trouble finding us or will be arriving late, please call Catherine at 774 232 0000 or look for us inside. Tickets are $12 or free for museum members.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet by the ticket purchasing area. If you have trouble finding us or will be arriving late, please call Catherine at 774 232 0000 or look for us inside.
item.name: Gardner After Hours- Evening of Mingling, Cocktails and Art
